intro: Tovara ryukuyuensis, commonly known as the Ryukyu tovara, is a rare flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Its leaves are elliptical with a glossy surface and emit a mild aromatic scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
